intro: Hieracium megalops, commonly known as the giant hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring bright yellow flowers that bloom from June to September. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its roots are fibrous and rhizomatous. Hieracium megalops is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can sometimes become invasive in certain regions.
